Key Match Events: San Diego Padres left fielder Jurickson Profar was hit by items thrown by fans, including baseballs and trash, causing a 12-minute delay between pitches in the seventh inning of Game 2 of a baseball NL Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers on Sunday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt said, 'That's just not acceptable.'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'It was ugly.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The best-of-five series moves to Petco Park for Game 3 on Tuesday.
Padres slugger Manny Machado said, 'You're in a tough environment, you're going to get some things said to you but once you start throwing things onto the field that's just uncalled for.'
Others: Umpire crew chief Dan Bellino said, 'We would not hesitate to do that if we thought that their safety was in jeopardy.'
